      Parses the string value argument using locale passed in locale argument, and the date format pattern specified by the pattern argument, and the time zone information specified by time_zone argument, expecting a time stamp and returns the value found as a Timestamp object.

    • Method Detail

      • toBoolean

        public static java.lang.Boolean toBoolean(java.lang.String value,
                                          java.util.Locale locale)
        Converts the locale specific value argument into the corresponding Boolean object. This method retrieves the TRUE_STRING and FALSE_STRING strings using locale argument and compares the results with value argument content.

        If value argument matches with TRUE_STRING, then a Boolean with TRUE value is returned; and if the value argument matches with FALSE_STRING then Boolean with FALSE value is returned.

        It will return null if value argument is null, empty or cannot be converted to Boolean.



        Supported API: true

        Parameters:
        value - string value to be parsed into Boolean
        locale - locale to be used while parsing the value argument's content
        Returns:
        returns a Boolean representing the content of the value argument, returns null if the value argument in is null, empty or cannot be parsed into Boolean.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Boolean value,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
        Takes a Boolean value argument and returns its String representation using the locale specified by locale argument.

        If the value argument is null then empty string is returned.



        Supported API: true

        Parameters:
        value - a Boolean object
        locale - locale to be used to convert Boolean object to its localized String representation
        Returns:
        returns String representation of the value argument in locale argument locale; if the value argument is null, it returns empty string.

      • toFloatingPoint

        public static FloatingPoint toFloatingPoint(java.lang.String value,
                                            java.util.Locale locale)
                                     throws java.text.ParseException
        Converts the locale specific value argument into the corresponding FloatingPoint object.

        If the value argument is null or if it is empty string then null will be returned. If the locale argument is null then locale is set to the current context's locale.



        Supported API: true

        Parameters:
        value - string value to be parsed into FloatingPoint
        locale - locale to be used while parsing the value argument's content
        Returns:
        returns a FloatingPoint representing the value in the value argument, if the value argument is null or if it is empty string then null will be returned
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - is thrown if the value argument cannot be parsed into a number

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(FloatingPoint value,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
        Returns the localized representation of the FloatingPoint value argument as String. This method should be used to displayed the FloatingPoint object according to the rules of the locale in terms of number separator and other locale specific rules.



        Supported API: true

        Parameters:
        value - a FloatingPoint object
        locale - locale that the String will be represented
        Returns:
        returns the localized representation of the FloatingPoint value argument

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(FloatingPoint value,
                                        int displayPrecision,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
        Returns the localized representation of the FloatingPoint value argument as String with precision specified by displayPrecision argument. If value argument is null then empty string is returned. If the locale argument is null then locale is set to the current context's locale.



        Supported API: true

        Parameters:
        value - a FloatingPoint object
        displayPrecision - an integer representing the precision to be used in returned string value
        locale - locale that the String will be represented in
        Returns:
        returns the localized representation of the FloatingPoint value argument

      • toFloatingPointWithUnits

        public static FloatingPointWithUnits toFloatingPointWithUnits(java.lang.String value,
                                                              java.lang.String defaultUnits,
                                                              java.util.Locale locale)
                                                       throws java.text.ParseException,
                                                              UnitFormatException,
                                                              IncompatibleUnitsException
        Returns a FloatingPointWithUnits object parsing the String value argument using the locale argument passed in; if the value argument doesn't contain units information, then the units info in defaultUnits argument is used as units of the value.

        If value is null or empty string, null is returned. If any units parsed from value argument are not compatible with units parsed from defaultUnits argument, an IncompatibleUnitsException will be thrown. If the locale argument is null then locale is set to the current context's locale.



        Supported API: true

        Parameters:
        value - a String value to be parsed into a FloatingPointWithUnits, it should contain number and units information
        defaultUnits - the units of the value if the passed value does not already contain units. If any contained units are not compatible with these units, an IncompatibleUnitsException will be thrown.
        locale - locale to be used while parsing the value argument's content
        Returns:
        returns a FloatingPointWithUnits representation of the value argument
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException
        wt.units.UnitFormatException
        wt.units.IncompatibleUnitsException
        UnitFormatException
        IncompatibleUnitsException

      • toFloatingPointWithUnits

        public static FloatingPointWithUnits toFloatingPointWithUnits(java.lang.String value,
                                                              java.util.Locale locale)
                                                       throws java.text.ParseException,
                                                              UnitFormatException
        Returns a FloatingPointWithUnits object parsing the String value argument using the locale argument passed in. It is assumed that the value and the Units are separated by a space and the value comes first. If there is more content after the Units info, a ParseException is thrown. If value is null or empty string, null is returned. If the locale argument is null then locale is set to the current context's locale.



        Supported API: true

        Parameters:
        value - a String value to be parsed into a FloatingPointWithUnits, it should contain number and units information
        locale - locale to be used while parsing the value argument's content
        Returns:
        returns a FloatingPointWithUnits representation of the value argument
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException
        wt.units.UnitFormatException
        UnitFormatException

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(FloatingPointWithUnits value,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
        Returns the String representation of data in the value argument in the locale specified with locale argument. If the value argument is null, then empty string is returned.



        Supported API: true

        Parameters:
        value - a FloatingPointWithUnits object containing a number and Units information
        locale - locale that the String will be represented in
        Returns:
        a localized String representation of the FloatingPointWithUnits value argument

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(FloatingPointWithUnits value,
                                        int displayPrecision,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
        Returns the String representation of data in the value argument in the locale specified with locale argument and up to the precision of the displayPrecision argument. If the value argument is null, then empty string is returned.



        Supported API: true

        Parameters:
        value - a FloatingPointWithUnits object containing a number and Units information
        displayPrecision - precision to be used while calculating the string representation
        locale - locale that the String will be represented in
        Returns:
        String a localized String representation of the FloatingPointWithUnits value argument

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(FloatingPointWithUnits value,
                                        java.lang.String unitsString,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
                                 throws UnitFormatException,
                                        IncompatibleUnitsException
        Returns the String representation of data in the value argument in the locale specified with locale argument and up to the precision calculated using the value argument and Units in unitString If the value argument is null, then empty string is returned.



        Supported API: true

        Parameters:
        value - a FloatingPointWithUnits object containing a number and Units information
        unitsString - a String holding Units information to be used to get display precision
        locale - locale that the String will be represented in
        Returns:
        String a localized String representation of the FloatingPointWithUnits value argument
        Throws:
        wt.units.UnitFormatException - is thrown if unitsString cannot be parsed to a valid units
        wt.units.IncompatibleUnitsException - is thrown if units specified by unitsString isn't compatible with units specified in value argument
        UnitFormatException
        IncompatibleUnitsException

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(FloatingPointWithUnits value,
                                        java.lang.String unitsString,
                                        int displayPrecision,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
                                 throws UnitFormatException,
                                        IncompatibleUnitsException
        Returns the String representation of data in the value argument in the locale specified with locale argument and up to the precision of the displayPrecision argument after converting it to the units specified in unitString argument. If the value argument is null, then empty string is returned.



        Supported API: true

        Parameters:
        value - a FloatingPointWithUnits object containing a number and Units information
        unitsString - a String holding Units information to be used to convert the value in value argument, returned String value representation will be in this unit
        displayPrecision - precision of the data in returned representation
        locale - locale that the return value will be represented in
        Returns:
        a localized String representation of the FloatingPointWithUnits value argument in units specified with unitString argument
        Throws:
        wt.units.UnitFormatException
        wt.units.IncompatibleUnitsException
        UnitFormatException
        IncompatibleUnitsException

      • getValue

        public static java.lang.String getValue(FloatingPointWithUnits value,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
        Returns localized String representation of the numeric value contained in value argument, does not contain the units information in the output. If the value argument is null, then empty string is returned.

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        value - a FloatingPointWithUnits object containing a number and Units information
        locale - locale that the return value will be represented in
        Returns:
        String a localized String representation of the FloatingPointWithUnits value argument's value, not including the units info

      • getDisplayPrecision

        public static int getDisplayPrecision(FloatingPointWithUnits value,
                                      java.lang.String displayUnits)
                               throws UnitFormatException,
                                      IncompatibleUnitsException
        Returns the default precision information for a FloatingPointWithUnits object in another unit. For example if the FloatingPointWithUnits object is in m and we need to display it in mm this method takes it into account and gives back the proper precision information. If the value argument is null, then -1 is returned. If the displayUnits argument is null, then precision of the value argument is returned

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        value - a FloatingPointWithUnits object containing a number and Units information
        displayUnits - the unit we like to see the precision information for
        Returns:
        int precision of the value argument content when it is converted to the unit represented by displayUnit argument
        Throws:
        UnitFormatException
        IncompatibleUnitsException

      • getValue

        public static java.lang.String getValue(FloatingPointWithUnits value,
                                        int displayPrecision,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
        Returns the String representation of the value of a FloatingPointWithUnits object given a precision and locale If the value argument is null, then empty string is returned.

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        value - a FloatingPointWithUnits object containing a number and Units information
        displayPrecision - precision in which the returned string value should be calculated
        locale - locale information to be used for localization of the number format for string display
        Returns:
        localized string representation of value argument in specified displayPrecision and locale

      • getValue

        public static java.lang.String getValue(FloatingPointWithUnits value,
                                        java.lang.String unitsString,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
                                 throws UnitFormatException,
                                        IncompatibleUnitsException
        Returns the String representation of the value of a FloatingPointWithUnits object given a unit and locale in default precision If the value argument is null, then empty string is returned. For example a value of 5 m in a FloatingPointWithUnits object can be passed in with mm in unitsString and en_us being the locale. In this case the value will be converted to mm and string format would be arranged according to en_us locale.

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        value - must not be null, otherwise empty string will be returned
        unitsString - the unit in which the string presentation will be
        locale -
        Returns:
        empty locale formatted string representation of the value in unit specified by unitsString argument
        Throws:
        UnitFormatException
        IncompatibleUnitsException

      • getValue

        public static java.lang.String getValue(FloatingPointWithUnits value,
                                        java.lang.String unitsString,
                                        int displayPrecision,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
                                 throws UnitFormatException,
                                        IncompatibleUnitsException
        Returns the string representation of the value of FloatingPointWithUnits object in unit specified by unitsString argument and in precision specified by displayPrecision argument and in localized format in locale specified by locale argument If the value argument is null, then empty string is returned. If locale is null then the current context's locale is used If the unitsString is not null value is converted to this unit, otherwise used as is If the base unit of the value in value argument is "USD", there is special handling to handle negative numbers and precision values for example if the precision is set to maximum precision it is reset to 14, and truncation might occur, also if the precision is set to a number higher than 14 it is reset to 14.

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        value - a FloatingPointWithUnits object
        unitsString - specifies in which unit the value will be represented as string
        displayPrecision - specifies the precision of the string representation
        locale - specifies the locale for the string display
        Returns:
        String
        Throws:
        wt.units.UnitFormatException
        wt.units.IncompatibleUnitsException
        UnitFormatException
        IncompatibleUnitsException

      • toLong

        public static java.lang.Long toLong(java.lang.String value,
                                    java.util.Locale locale)
                             throws java.text.ParseException
        Parses the string value argument using locale passed in locale argument and returns the value found as a Long object. If value is null or empty string, null is returned If locale is null then the current context's locale is used

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        value -
        locale -
        Returns:
        Long
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Long value,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
        Returns a string representation of the Long value passed in the locale specified by locale argument If value is null or empty string, null is returned If locale is null then the current context's locale is used

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        value -
        locale -
        Returns:
        String which will always be formatted.

      • toTimestamp

        public static java.sql.Timestamp toTimestamp(java.lang.String value,
                                             java.util.Locale locale)
        Parses the string value argument using locale passed in locale argument expecting a time stamp and returns the value found as a Timestamp object. Timezone information is retrieved from the current context. If value is null or empty string, null is returned If locale is null then the current context's locale is used

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        value -
        locale -
        Returns:
        Timestamp

      • toTimestamp

        public static java.sql.Timestamp toTimestamp(java.lang.String value,
                                             java.lang.String pattern,
                                             java.util.Locale locale,
                                             java.util.TimeZone time_zone)
        Parses the string value argument using locale passed in locale argument, and the date format pattern specified by the pattern argument, and the time zone information specified by time_zone argument, expecting a time stamp and returns the value found as a Timestamp object. pattern argument is used as an input to SimpleDateFormat API implementation to get the date format needed. If pattern is null then utilResource.LONG_STANDARD_DATE_FORMAT_MINUS_TIMEZONE is used as pattern value. If value is null or empty string, null is returned If locale is null then the current context's locale is used If time_zone is null then the current context's time zone is used

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        value -
        pattern - pattern argument is used as an input to SimpleDateFormat API implementation to get the date format needed.
        locale -
        time_zone -
        Returns:
        Timestamp

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.sql.Timestamp value,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
        Returns the localized String representation of the Timestamp object that is passed in in locale specified by locale argument.

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:

        locale -
        Returns:

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.sql.Timestamp value,
                                        java.lang.String pattern,
                                        java.util.Locale locale)
        Returns the localized String representation of the Timestamp object that is passed in in locale specified by locale argument using the time stamp format specified by pattern argument

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        value -
        pattern - pattern argument is used as an input to SimpleDateFormat API implementation to get the date format needed.
        locale -
        Returns:
        String

      • toRatio

        public static Ratio toRatio(java.lang.String value,
                            java.util.Locale locale)
        Parses a String value argument using a locale and returns a Ratio object. Ratio's numerator and denominator is set according to the locale's number format. If value is null or empty string, null is returned. If locale is null then the current context's locale is used

        Supported API: true
        Parameters:
        value -
        locale -
        Returns:
        Ratio
